abstract: Animates changes using the animation in the current transaction.

declaration.code: @MainActor @preconcurrency func animate(changes: () -> Void, completion: (() -> Void)? = nil)

overview:
## Discussion

This combines doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIView/4429628-animate with the current transaction’s animation. When you start a SwiftUI animation using [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/withAnimation(_:_:)] and have a mutated SwiftUI state that causes the representable object to update, use this method to animate changes in the representable object using the same `Animation` timing.
title: animate(changes:completion:)
